item.title: Allegra add a quote by W.H. Auden
item.description: "You owe it to all of us to get on with what you're good at." -- W.H. Auden

item.title: Allegra add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "He never seemed to grasp the immense mutability of human nature, nor to appreciate that behind every nondescript face lay a wild and unique hinterland like his own." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Allegra add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "She was actively frightened of imparting confidences, because she feared that they might betray the world of oddness that lived inside her" -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Allegra add a quote by John Irving
item.description: "In this dirty minded world, you are either someone's wife or someone's whore. And if you're not either people think there is something wrong with you....but there is nothing wrong with me" -- John Irving

item.title: Allegra add a quote by John Irving
item.description: "They were involved in that awkward procedure of getting to unknow each other." -- John Irving

item.title: Allegra add a quote by John Irving
item.description: "Oh FUCK the longings and agonies of youth." -- John Irving

item.title: Allegra add a quote by John Irving
item.description: "Garp drank the beer and wondered if everything was an anticlimax.." -- John Irving

item.title: Allegra add a quote by John Irving
item.description: "You only grow by coming to the end of something and by beginning something else." -- John Irving

item.title: Allegra add a quote by John Irving
item.description: "He wished he could arrange a maiming as a kind of moral lesson" -- John Irving

item.title: Allegra add a quote by Jonathan Franzen
Allegra add a quote by Jonathan Franzen
item.description: "He couldn't figure out if she was immensely well adjusted or seriously messed up." -- Jonathan Franzen

item.title: Allegra add a quote by Jonathan Franzen
item.description: "Life, in her experience, had a kind of velvet luster. You looked at yourself from one perspective and all you saw was weirdness. Move your head a little bit, though, and everything looked reasonably normal." -- Jonathan Franzen

item.title: Allegra add a quote by Jonathan Franzen
item.description: "Being dead's only a problem if you know you're dead, which you never do because you're dead!" -- Jonathan Franzen

item.title: Allegra add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "More and more, it feels like I'm doing a really bad impersonation of myself." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Allegra add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "We can spend our lives letting the world tell us who we are. Sane or insane. Saints or sex addicts. Heroes or victims. Letting history tell us how good or bad we are. Letting our past decide our future. Or we can decide for ourselves. And maybe it's our job to invent something better." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Allegra add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "You gain power by pretending to be weak." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Allegra add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "Torture is torture and humiliation is humiliation only when you choose to suffer." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Allegra add a quote by John Irving
item.description: "It is hard work and great art to make life not so serious." -- John Irving

item.title: Allegra add a quote by John Irving
item.description: "So we dream on. Thus we invent our lives. We give ourselves a sainted mother, we make our father a hero; and someone’s older brother and someone’s older sister – they become our heroes too. We invent what we love and what we fear. There is always a brave lost brother – and a little lost sister, too. We dream on and on: the best hotel, the perfect family, the resort life. And our dreams escape us almost as vividly as we can imagine them… That’s what happens, like it or not. And because that’s what happens, this is what we need: we need a good, smart bear… Coach Bob knew it all along: you’ve got to get obsessed and stay obsessed. You have to keep passing the open windows." -- John Irving

item.title: Allegra add a quote by John Irving
item.description: "Human beings are remarkable - at what we can learn to live with. If we couldn't get strong from what we lose, and what we miss, and what we want and can't have, then we couldn't ever get strong enough, could we? What else makes us strong?" -- John Irving

item.title: Allegra add a quote by John Irving
item.description: "Safer than we are.” I told Franny. “Safer than love.” “let me tell ya kid,” Franny said to me, squeezing my hand. “Everything’s safer than love." -- John Irving

item.title: Allegra add a quote by Dave Eggers
item.description: "I will not wait to love as best as I can. We thought we were young and that there would be time to love well sometime in the future. This is a terrible way to think. It is no way to live, to wait to love." -- Dave Eggers

item.title: Allegra add a quote by Dave Eggers
item.description: "I often cannot believe the things I do." -- Dave Eggers

item.title: Allegra add a quote by Michael Chabon
item.description: "It's always been hard for me to tell the difference between denial and what used to be known as hope." -- Michael Chabon

item.title: Allegra add a quote by W H Auden
item.description: "We would rather be ruined than changed We would rather die in our dread Than climb the cross of the moment And let our illusions die." -- W H Auden

item.title: Allegra add a quote by W.H. Auden
item.description: "Desire, even in its wildest tantrums, can neither persuade me it is love nor stop me from wishing it were." -- W.H. Auden

item.title: Allegra add a quote by Auden
item.description: "Love each other or perish" -- Auden

item.title: Allegra add a quote by W. H. Auden
item.description: "I and the public know What all schoolchildren learn, Those to whom evil is done Do evil in return." -- W. H. Auden

item.title: Allegra add a quote by Wystan Hugh Auden
item.description: "A real book is not one that we read, but one that reads us. " -- Wystan Hugh Auden

item.title: Allegra add a quote by W.H. Auden
item.description: "Thank God for books as an alternative to conversation." -- W.H. Auden
